title: OrgDevice
description: The data structure that represents an organization device resource.

id.description: The opaque resource ID that uniquely identifies the resource.

links.description: Navigational links that include the self-link.

relationships.description: Navigational links to related data and included resource types and IDs.

OrgDevice.Attributes.title: OrgDevice.Attributes
OrgDevice.Attributes.description: Attributes that describe an organization device resource.

addedToOrgDateTime.description: The date and time of adding the device to an organization.

orderDateTime.description: The date and time of placing the device’s order.

orderNumber.description: The order number of the device.

partNumber.description: The part number of the device.

productFamily.description: The device’s Apple product family: iPhone, iPad,Mac, AppleTV, Watch, or Vision

productType.description: The device’s product type: (examples: iPhone14,3, iPad13,4, MacBookPro14,2)

purchaseSourceId.description: The unique ID of the purchase source type: Apple Customer Number or Reseller Number

purchaseSourceType.description: The device’s purchase source type: APPLE, RESELLER, or MANUALLY_ADDED

status.description: The devices status: ASSIGNED or UNASSIGNED. If ASSIGNED, use a separate API to get the information of the assigned server.

updatedDateTime.description: The date and time of the most-recent update for the device.

OrgDevice.Relationships.title: OrgDevice.Relationships
OrgDevice.Relationships.description: The relationships you include in the request, and those that you can operate on.

assignedServer.description: The relationship representing a device and its assigned device management service.

OrgDevice.Relationships.AssignedServer.title: OrgDevice.Relationships.AssignedServer
OrgDevice.Relationships.AssignedServer.description: The links that describe the relationship between the resources.
